title: 4 Easy Ways to Disconnect AirPods from All Devices

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. [1] X Research source Use this method if you want to disconnect AirPods from your iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Tap Bluetooth.
steps.content: Tap Bluetooth . You should see your AirPods listed underneath My Devices .

steps.title: Tap the i next to the AirPods.
steps.content: Tap the i next to the AirPods. This will open a new page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Forget This Device.
steps.content: Tap Forget This Device . This will be on the very bottom of the screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Forget Device.
steps.content: Tap Forget Device . This will be in red. [4] X Research source The AirPods will be disconnected from your device. You will be unable to use it unless you pair the AirPods again.

steps.title: Open the Find My app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Find My app on your iPhone or iPad. Make sure the AirPods are nearby and connected via Bluetooth. [5] X Research source AirPods can only be associated with one Apple ID at a time. If you're using previously owned AirPods, the past owner will need to remove the AirPods from their Apple ID. If you're unable to contact them, use the next method to reset the AirPods. Be sure to update your iOS . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Devices.
steps.content: Tap Devices . This will show you a list of all devices connected to your Apple ID. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the AirPods.
steps.content: Tap the AirPods. You'll find the device's information.

steps.title: Tap Remove This Device.
steps.content: Tap Remove This Device . You may need to swipe up to find this option. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Remove to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Remove to confirm. The AirPods will be removed from the Apple ID. [9] X Research source When you set up the AirPods on your Apple ID, you can use Find My to track lost AirPods.

steps.title: Open your AirPods case.
steps.content: Open your AirPods case. Make sure both AirPods are inside the case. [10] X Research source You will see a light activate between the two AirPods. If you don't see it, you'll need to charge your AirPods first.

steps.title: Press and hold the back button.
steps.content: Press and hold the back button. This can be found on the back of the AirPods. [11] X Research source You'll need to remove any protective casing. The button can be difficult to see under dirt and debris, so be sure to clean your AirPods case . [12] X Research source

steps.title: Close the AirPods case.
steps.content: Close the AirPods case. When the light between the two AirPods begins to flash, it will be successfully reset and ready to pair as new. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Charge your AirPods Max.
steps.content: Charge your AirPods Max. You'll need the device to be on in order to reset it. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the noise control button and the Digital Crown.
steps.content: Press and hold the noise control button and the Digital Crown. These are located on the left ear. You'll need to hold the buttons together for at least 15 seconds. [15] X Research source The LED (located on the bottom of the left ear) will flash amber, then white. Your AirPods Max will be reset and ready to pair as new.
